Description: Oval bezel of an integral corroded copper alloy finger-ring, with a hieroglyphic inscription to read from right to left.
Curator's comments: Maybe one of the 33 "bronze rings" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 80 § 80, though the author says that they are "mainly Roman and Cufic, of no particular interest, with the usual devices" and that only "one is Egyptian, minutely inscribed Ptah-hotep" (London, BM, EA 23897). See also the silver inscribed rings fron the site (ibid., p. 76 § 75) : London, BM, EA 18302 and 23852 to 23858.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 80 § 80) (?)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.40, p.68, p.182, pl.24)
